value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">attend her. And she is for ever asserting her self, her</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">property, with [critical?] carved in stone, even over</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">farm house walls. This is her property; this land</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is hers. Her <del>sense</del> of <del>the rights of blood,</del> of something</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sacred in flesh & blood: <add>so</add> when Lord <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-eshe" key="Sheffield, Edmund">Sheffield</rs> marries</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-mirw" key="Erwin, Anne">Anne Erwin</rs> it "<quote source="#" rend="inline">was held a very mean</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">match, an indiscreet on part of him.</quote>" <del>already</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add place="margin">For</add> the noble families, the Herberts, the Russels, the Stanleys</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">are already <del>weaving themselves together; & there at</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>set apart</del> <del>weaving their</del> webs, at the centre of which is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-kjam" key="James I of England and VI of Scotland">King James</rs></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Her whole effort is to count, <del>to amass</del>, to hoard; <del>& to</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">as if she had no sense of change; as if she believed that</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">it is not only right but <del>[advisaber?] to</del> <del>that the concrete</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>body, <del>it</del> can <del>survive</del> survive; as if there were for her</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">an immortality of the body:</l>

<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>are most</l>
            <l><del>proclaim its</del></l>
            <l><del>solidity under</del></l>
            <l><del>just</del></l>
            <l>believe in the</l>
            <l>body, as one</l>
            <l>believes in the</l>
            <l>soul</l>
          </add>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Yet there were moments when <del>hear</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">carapace of <del>possessions</del> proved to much to be any <del>for her: when</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">she upon the 1st [score?] by times in the morning</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& went up to the Pagan Tower to say prayers & saw</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the sun rise, <del>again <add place="inline">she saw</add> a strange comet like a</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>canopy in the air:</del></l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="inline" rend="block">
            <l>If I had not excellent <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gcha">Chaucer</rs> back here to comfort me,</l>
            <l>I were in a pitiable case, having so many troubles</l>
            <l>as I have here, but when I read in that, I scorn &</l>
            <l>make light of them all, & a little part of his</l>
            <l>beauteous spirit infuses itself in me"</l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is <del>a queer transition</del> a strange reversal – <del>for the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">world <del>of rubies & diamonds,</del> from the solid</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">earth <del>to the</del> of <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-west" key="Westmoreland">Westmoreland</rs>, to the other world<del>; &</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a [feverish?] one, when her eye turns from the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">delight of possessing land, to the other delight of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a change of [public?] office, & these abide in</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-knol" key="Knole">Knole</rs>, & she adds that postcript to a letter about</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a little cabinet a cup 
            <choice>
              <sic>wh.</sic>
              <corr>which</corr>
            </choice> she had left with</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Lady <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-egre" key="Grey, Elizabeth">Kent</rs>, when she borrowed a hundred pounds <del>off her</del></l>
